gurmukhi: jw Bgvwn ikDo sIX jIq kY mwir frXo irp rwvn gwFo ]qw Bgvwn ikDo muK qy mukqw nukqw sm AMmiRq kwFo ]461]
transliteration: Jaa Bhagvaan Kidho Seeya Jeet Kai Daar(i) Daryo Rip Raavan Gaddho|| Taa Bhagvaan Kidho Moukh Te Mouktaa Nouktaa Sam Anmrit Kaadho||461||
translation: That Lord, who had conquered Sita by killing his horrible enemy Ravana, the same Lord at this time is creating a sound beautiful like gems and very sweet like ambrosia.461.
Speech of Krishna addressed to gopis:

gurmukhi: Awj BXo JV hY jmnw qt Kyln kI Ab Gwq bxI ]qj kY fru Kyl krY hm so kib sXwm khXo his kwnH AxI ]
transliteration: Ooj Bhayo Jhad Hai Jamnaa Tat Khelan Kighaat Banee|| Taj Kai Dar(u) Khel Darai Ham So Kabi Syaam Kahyo Has(i) Kaahn Anee||
translation: Today, there are also a few clouds in the sky and my mind is getting impatient to play on the bank of Yamuna; Krishna said smilingly, “All of you may wander with me fearlessly;

gurmukhi: joaU suMdr hY qum mY soaU Kylhu Kylhu Kylhu nwih jxI ru kxI ]ieh BwNq khY khY his kY rs bol ikDo hirqw joaU mwn PxI ]462]
transliteration: Jooo Soundar Hai Toum Mai Sooo Kheloh Kheloh Naah(i) Janiru Kanee|| Eh Bhaant Kahai Kahai Has(i) Kai Ras Bol Kidho Hartaa Jooo Maan Phanee||462||
translation: “The most beautiful from you may come with me, the others may not come;” Krishna, the smasher of the pride of the serpent Kali, uttered such-like words.462.

gurmukhi: his kY su khI bqIAw iqn so kib sXwm khY hir jo rs rwqo ]nYn miRgIpiq sy ihq ky iem cwl clY ijm g`eIXr mwqo ]
transliteration: Has(i) Kai Su Kahibateeaa Tin So Kabi Syaam Kahai Har(i) Jo Ras Raato|| Nain Mrigeepat(i) Se Hit Ke Im Dhaal Chalai Jim Gadeyar Maato||
translation: Krishna said such words smilingly and steeped in sentiment; his eyes are like deer and gait like an intoxicated elephant;

gurmukhi: dyKq mUrq kwnH kI gopn BUil geI giH kI swqo ]cIr gey auf kY qn ky Aru tUt gXo nYn qy lwj ko nwqo ]463]
transliteration: Dekhat Moondat Kaahn Kigopan Bhool(i) Gadgrih Kisaato|| Cheer Gad Ud Kai Tan Ke Ar(u) Toot Gyo Nain Te Laaj Ko Naato||463||
translation: Seeing his beauty the gopis lost all other consciousness; the garments dropped from their bodies and they abandoned all shyness.463.

gurmukhi: kuip kY miD kYtB qwn mry mur dYq mrXo Apny ijn hwQw ]jwih BBICn rwj dXo irs rwvn kwt dey ijh mwQw ]
transliteration: Koup(i) Kai Madh(i) Kaitabh Taan Dare Mur Dait Daryo Apne Jin Haathaa|| Jaah(i) Bhabheechhan Raaj Dayo Ris Raavan Kaat Dae Jih Maahaa||
translation: He, who on being enraged, killed the demons named Madhu, Kaitabh and Mur; he, who gave kingdom to Vibhishana and chopped the ten heads of Ravana;

gurmukhi: so iqh kI iqhu logn m`D khY kib sXwm clY jYsy gwQw ]so biRj BUm ibKY rs ky ihq Kylq hY Pun gopn swQw ]464]
transliteration: So Tih Kitih(u) Logad Maddh Kahai Kabi Syaam Chalai Jaise Gadthaa|| So Brij Bhoom Bikhai Ras Ke Hit Khelat Hai Phoun Gopan Saathaa||464||
translation: The story of his victory prevails in all the three worlds; he is the same, who is absorbed in amorous play with the gopis at this time.464.

gurmukhi: his kY hir jU biRjmMfl mY sMg gopn ky iek hof bdI ]sB Dwie prY hmhUM qumhUM ieh BwNq khXo imil bIc ndI ]
transliteration: Has(i) Kai Har(i) Joo Brijmandal Mai San Gopan Ke Ik Hod Badee|| Sabh Dhaae Darai Ham-hoon Toum-hoon Eh Bhaant Kahyo Mil(i) Beech Nadee||
translation: Krishna, smilingly talked about a play involving bet, with the gopis of Braja and said, “Come, let us jump into the river together;”

gurmukhi: jb jwie pry jmnw jl mY sMg gopn ky Bgvwn jdI ]qb lY cuBkI hir jI qiRX ko su lXo muK cUm ikDo su qdI ]465]
transliteration: Jah Jaae Dare Jamnaa Jal Mai San Gopan Ke Bhagvaan Jadee|| Tah Lai Choubhakihar(i) Jitriya Ko Su Layo Moukh Choom Kidho Su Tadee||465||
translation: In this way, when Krishna jumped into the water of Yamuna alongwith the gopis, then he very quickly kissed the face of one of them after diving.465.
Speech of the gopis addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: iml kY sB gÍwrn suMdr sXwm so sXwm khI his bwq pRbInn ]rwjq jih miRgI piq sy diRg Cwjq cMclqw sm mInn ]
transliteration: Mil Kai Sabh Gvaaran Soundar Syaam So Syaam Kahihas(i) Baat Prabeenan|| Raajat Jah(i) Mrigipat(i) Se Drig Chhaadat Channdhaltaa Sam Meenan||
translation: All the gopis together smilingly said cunningly to Krishna, whose beautiful eyes are big like deer and agile like fish;
